summary:
The Fukushima nuclear accident happened in Japan in 2011 after an earthquake and tsunami. The power plant lost power, causing reactors to overheat. This led to the release of radioactive material into the environment. It was a very serious incident, similar to the Chernobyl disaster.

While there were no immediate deaths from radiation, many people had to leave their homes. Some faced health issues like cancer and radiation burns. The accident also caused fear and stress among residents. Critics question the handling of the evacuation and wastewater treatment.
title: Fukushima nuclear accident
